website_summaries.verdict: The design of Toshiba's high-end Kirabook hasn't changed since last year, but it has aged gracefully. The components get an update and the battery life gets a big boost, making this an all-around excellent, but expensive, ultrabook.
pros: The slim, lightweight Toshiba Kirabook still feels very premium, and it deserves credit for being one of the first Windows laptops to feature a better-than-HD display
Thanks to an updated CPU, battery life is now good enough for all-day use
cons: Higher-res screens are more common now, and available for less
The generic brushed-metal look isn't particularly distinctive given the price

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: My ONLY complaint is working with two monitors in Windows 8.1. Fitting such a high res display in a 13" screen was a bit too much for Windows 8.1. Due to high res features being limited in Windows 8.1, to make appropriate font/display adjustments (bigger font-size feature, etc) requires a log out and log in again. That means when you hook up your Kirabook to an external monitor, you'll have to reduce the font, display sizes, log out and back in for the external monitor to not show super big text/windows. I hear MSFT is working on fixing this nuisance, but that's all it is, a nuisance. The laptop is pricey but amazing.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: I love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. It is the best buy available given the two year warranty, two year software and hardware support and two year's of Norton's... not to mention the third USB port... a bonus on this sized of machine. A great "bang for the buck" package! I hate Windows 8.1... what were they thinking... how could they have blown it this badly? I'm looking forward to Windows 10. Windows 8 makes the two years of support in this package a definite bonus. Go Toshiba...
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: good price for a laptop with many high end features
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, fast startup, touch screen is very good, nice sound from built in speakers, no setup required and programs are current.
customer_reviews.author: David McKee

customer_reviews.title: I'm an author and got it because it was light and easily portable. However
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the problem is, but it seems to have issues with loading graphics. I'm an author and got it because it was light and easily portable. However, when I try to download my book to the various websites, I have to reboot after each one. I also get graphics that won't load and/or DNS failures whenever I do "too much" viewing of graphics--such as surfing through Amazon, Lowes, etc. or playing a FB game. I always have to reboot to continue, and it doesn't matter which browser I use--Chrome, Firefox, or Explorer. Wish I'd have bought a different computer.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I'd love to return it but I use it to run ...
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the most temperamental computer I have ever owned. I have been buying Asus for years for my company and decided to branch out for a change. Within days of receiving this laptop it had battery issues. I had to replace the battery twice. It's less than a year old and I still have problems - shuts down when unplugged, won't charge whilst plugged in. Trued updating the Bios but that didn't work. I'd love to return it but I use it to run my business and I travel constantly. When am I going to get the chance to get it fixed? Never again, Toshiba!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Computer.  Windows 8.1 Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Nice, light, quick computer. Windows 8.1 sucks the big one. Unfortunately, I seem to be stuck with this awful operating system. I'm not really impressed with touch on a laptop, seems pointless and really annoying when pointing out something to someone since I invariably touch the screen and wreck was I was trying to show. Touch on a laptop does not enhance productivity since a mouse is more efficient. Windows 8.1: It is nearly impossible to get the panel on the right side of the screen to display. Some kind of weird dance is needed with the mouse to have it pop-out. I love the features of the laptop. Hate Windows 8.1 which degrades the experience with the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Abc

customer_reviews.title: The laptop has numerous kinks that required intervention by the ...
customer_reviews.text: The laptop has numerous kinks that required intervention by the support team. I have owned the product for 8 days and I have already called support 5 times. I elicited various levels of technical skill from support, but generally they were able to fix the issues. I am still getting to know the laptop. I need to call support again because the wifi connectivity to other devices is not working . I can only give this product a three star for now.
customer_reviews.author: ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back for a refund
customer_reviews.text: Things that don't work: - Trackpad is jumpy, drived me completely crazy. - Wifi seems buggy, it would disconnect after a few hours and re-connect again. Sometimes it would disconnect and not reconnect needing a restart Things that don't work but may not be Toshiba's fault: - Ubuntu support is horrible, especially when it comes to the screen resolution Overall, it's a nice laptop with an impressive spec. But for this price, I should be getting a 'best of class' which this laptop is certainly not. Bottom line: struggled with it for 2 weeks and ended up sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Much Luck, with Toshiba Laptops...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this machine for the last 3 years and all is good. Tested Asus Zenbook Prime UX-31A, Lenovo X1 Carbon, Apple MacBook Pro and this silver supermodel beat them all. Best $450 I ever spent....
customer_reviews.author: Velocipede

customer_reviews.title: Working well for me
customer_reviews.text: So far the laptop has performed very well and I am pleased with the longer warranty provided on this model. With the SDD and the processor the system powers and boots up quickly, handles multi-tasking well and I have not had any issues with it other than adjusting the setting for my needs. It has not received any heavy duty use yet but is meeting my expectations so far.
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: Computer is great, battery does NOT last as long as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Computer is great, battery does NOT last as long as the documentation or the reviews say.... mine runs down within an hour or so, and I have sent the computer back to have them check to see if there is a short or something wrong that would be dragging on the battery. If you want a good computer, this is it, but don't expect to use it more than an hour before you have to plug it in,
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Now I have screen issues and it is completely useless. And the fan gets SUPER SUPER loud
customer_reviews.text: Over paid. Had screen cycling issues. Now I have screen issues and it is completely useless. And the fan gets SUPER SUPER loud.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chen
